problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What does 'mass composition' usually refer to in chemistry?
options: The mass percentages of each element in the compound
problems.hint: Think about breaking down by elements and masses.
problems.detailed: Mass composition tells you the percentage by mass of each element in a compound. Example: in \(\ce{H2O}\), you calculate how much of the mass comes from H & O.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: An aqueous solution contains 18 g of water (\(\ce{H2O}\)) and 2 g of salt (\(\ce{NaCl}\)). What is the mass concentration of water in the solution?
problems.hint: Compute total mass, then fraction due to water.
problems.detailed: Total mass = 18 + 2 = 20 g. Water mass concentration = \(18/20 \times 100% = 90\%\).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the mass concentration of carbon in \(\ce{CO2}\)? (Atomic masses: C = 12, O = 16)
problems.hint: Compare mass of C to total molar mass.
problems.detailed: Molar mass of \(\ce{CO2}\) = 12 + 2×16 = 44. Mass of C = 12. So fraction = \(12/44 \times 100 % ≈27.27\%\).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: A compound has formula \(\ce{Na2SO4}\). Which element contributes the greatest mass to this compound?
problems.hint: Consider atomic mass × number of atoms for each element.
problems.detailed: Atomic mass approx: Na = 23×2 =46; S≈32; O = 16×4 = 64. Oxygen’s total (64) is highest among them.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: If a 100 g sample of \(\ce{CaCO3}\) contains 40 g of calcium, what percent by mass of calcium is this compound?
problems.hint: What fraction of the sample’s mass is calcium?
problems.detailed: Calcium mass =40 g, total =100 g, so calcium mass percentage = \(40/100 \times 100 % = 40\%\).
